definition.text: Sweden is a constitutional monarchy in Northern Europe characterized by a high-income, export-oriented economy and a comprehensive welfare state. Historically transitioning from agrarian society to industrial power in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, Sweden developed globally competitive firms in engineering, automotive, telecommunications, and life sciences, supported by strong institutions, human capital formation, and social partnership models.

works.title: Actor Set Evolution of Sweden

works.title: Regional Spatial-Administrative Structure
works.description: Geospatial representation of counties, metropolitan regions, transport infrastructure, and spatial concentration of industrial and knowledge clusters.
